intro: Senecio farriae, commonly known as the Farriae groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a cluster. Senecio farriae is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in well-drained conditions.
